channel.title: Error occurred during initializing of vm
channel.description: ok i have tried everything. i have download 27 servers of here and none of the sources work. th client and compiler works fine but not sources. when i double click it the prompt opens and says error occurred during initializing of vm could not reserve enough space for object heap could not create the java virtual machine press any key to continue... can some1 plz tell me how to do this cuz i have changed path variables and even updated my jre6 to jre7 and also dled jdk1.7.0_21. so what else is left??? any suggestions?

item.title: Error occurred during initializing of vm
item.dc:creator: @God_Pure1 God_Pure
item.description:
@God_Pure1 wrote:

I don’t get this, kids these days try to use all of their ram and don’t realise that some of it is not available due to being used by other programs, l2useTaskMannager to check this XD

item.title: Error occurred during initializing of vm
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

[quote=“alicaytheseventh, post:3, topic:519970”]well now it says this
invalid initial heap size:-Xms5000m
the specified size exceeds the maximum representable size
error: could not create java virtual machine
error: a fatal exception has occurred. the program will exit.
press any key to continue …[/quote]
Try replacing the 5000 by 2000, 1024, 512, 256 or 128

Read full topic

item.source: Error occurred during initializing of vm

item.title: Error occurred during initializing of vm
item.dc:creator: @Cres Cres
item.description:
@Cres wrote:

As a run argument, tell the VM or system (I have no idea to which the arguments are directed) to reserve some more memory for the JVM.
Look it up on Google about the arguments; I think it was -Xmx though I’m not certain.

EDIT: here, I looked it up for you;
-Xms5000m
That reserves 5000 megabytes for the JVM. ‘m’ indicates megabytes and ‘k’ indicates kilobytes.
The default should be +/- 2000 megabytes.

Read full topic
